channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @jen_mcfadden yes. who knows which idea is whose, but that company is set up to suck the life out of everything it comes in contact with. if she was just taking orders, the least she could do is quit. but she's still there.
@mialoira Fury? That is inside you, my friend.
@Talomo23 Good point. I wonder what Ms Sandberg would say about that.
@ericnuzum No sorry I don't think so.

Sheryl Sandberg on Russia-Ukraine: Women-led countries wouldn't go to war. (Impossible to know. And probably not true.) https://t.co/74nEk1wgRU
BTW there have been pairs of women leaders who didn't start wars, but most male leaders don't start wars either. Look at how long it has been since Europe had a war.
It's an dishonest statement though, like most gender boosting slogans. We create each other. I had a mother, so did every man. Where do you think we learned how to be who we are? Basically, if women are so great, why don't they raise better men?
There's even a song about that, written by Merle Haggard, but I like the Grateful Dead version better.
https://t.co/P0uXl2bSzN
But there's another Dead song that says that uncles have a lot of influence too. I concur, my uncle Ken was a big influence on me.
https://t.co/LiIWV3nNuo
Here's the last part of that song. His uncle taught him well.
Love my uncle, God rest his soul Taught me good, Lord, taught me all I know Taught me so well, that I grabbed that gold I left his dead ass there by the side of the road, yeah
Decades of debugging software helps you see patterns other people miss.
Coca-Cola, McDonald's, Pepsi and Starbucks suspend business in Russia. https://t.co/AmGyA3I93p
Aren’t you prohibited by the Geneva convention from publishing pictures of prisoners of war? https://t.co/RyYGJz1lCg

I don’t think it’s obvious that Putin will continue his march through Eastern Europe should he somehow prevail in Ukraine. And he could appear to prevail while failing to achieve his goal in Ukraine. Read more here… https://t.co/YbnuY4C20a
BTW, you never hear alternate theories of how the war will develop from journalism. They all tell the same story, Ukraine will be a quagmire because it’ll be just like Afghanistan, Syria or Vietnam.
There have been other patterns, and Putin is a bold and effective liar. Look at all the trump voters in the USA. They were all voting for Putin.
@asemota I think most want a laptop cause it seems simpler, fewer wires. https://t.co/Bz9PhaBrAz
What percentage of docs you write are printed?
Your Mix. Your Mic. https://t.co/teNJHWNVlg
Liz Cheney nails the truth about Trump, Ukraine and the ‘Putin wing of the GOP’. https://t.co/ZzUoiDIzOw
Amazon launches a ‘live radio’ app, Amp, which lets you play DJ with music and call-ins. https://t.co/PMSkiT0uxH
@kevin2kelly Thanks, good to know. 😀
Do Washingtonians Cheat on Wordle More Than Most? https://t.co/JYnuJi2OHL
Russell Westbrook says criticism from Lakers fans has crossed a line. https://t.co/t3Ri5tJdYP
I just got a link to this site. https://t.co/aY1GmWc8YG Scroll to the bottom to see how it works. Sounds kind of legit. I had not heard of it before. What do you think?

We live in Putin's America. People seem to have forgotten. We let them in for four years at the top of our government. You don't just vote them out. They stick around. https://t.co/PkhZhsy0O7
It's hard to get rid of a virus. They keep popping back.
If you used a Windows machine in the early 00s you learned all about this.
#malware.
@davidisen yup. and most people probably feel you're a fool if you aren't always trying to get yours no matter how much everything is falling apart.
@snarwani @TheCradleMedia https://t.co/t1p55eBVzm

1/5 People assume Russia will keep marching after taking Ukraine and presumably assassinating its president, the lovely Volodymyr Zelenskyy. This was discussed at the end of today's Daily podcast, where the reporter and host agreed that Putin will have a problem if he has
2/5 Zelenskyy assassinated. I'd like to propose an alternate theory. Once Zelenskyy is gone, Putin will give a speech saying that the Nazis did it. He will have a black ribbon on his lapel, the standard thing people will wear to mourn the death of Zelenskyy. He will say Russia
3/5 entered Ukraine to protect Zelenskyy, not to kill him. They will round up some Ukrainian "Nazis" and kill them. The Russian army, their job done, will return home, leaving Uktraine to be run by a Putin puppet. I think this is much more likely than Putin repeating his mistake
4/5 of invading Ukraine, or at least wait until a Putinite is in power in the US, and they've had a chance to withdraw from NATO, rendering it powerless,. Then all of Europe will recalculate and accept Russia as Stalin 2.0, and try to coexist, without the protection of the
5/5 American nuclear shield. Putin can continue looting the United States, and get started on Europe.
Don't forget, scattered throughout the governments of the world are figures who are being blackmailed by Putin. They can make things come out however he wants them to come out.
11-year-old Ukrainian boy fled to Slovakia by himself with just a bag, phone number and passport. https://t.co/oAUetAiM03
